subtasks.hazard: Vehicle fails PCC/PCI inspection due to mechanical defect or unsafe condition

values: Conduct preventative maintenance checks (PMCS) the day before marshalling
Complete a detailed pre‑movement checklist covering brakes, lights, seat belts, GHRs, fluid levels, and HAZMAT placards
Assign qualified Inspectors (CO/1SG or designated safety NCO) to verify all items before the 1130‑1230 inspection window
Any vehicle failing inspection is placed in a holding area for corrective action before re‑inspection
-Conduct PMCS on 29 MAY 25; -Complete a written PCC/PCI form; -Use a red/green tagging system to identify pass/fail
Vehicle Crews, Inspectors (CO/1SG), HHT Safety NCO

subtasks.hazard: Improper load securement leading to cargo shift during night maneuvers

values: Load Plan and Bump Plan must be reviewed and signed during the 1015‑1130 prep period
Tie‑downs inspected for proper tension and anchoring before the vehicle departs the marshaling yard
Rucksacks, ammunition, and equipment either stowed inside the vehicle or secured on top with approved straps
Trailer chains and parking brakes set to OFF only after load verification
-Use the Marshalling Checklist to verify each load point; -Perform a visual “shake‑test” before night movement
Vehicle Crews, Lead VC, HHT Inspection NCO

subtasks.hazard: Night‑time terrain navigation error resulting in vehicle collision or STX lane deviation

values: All crews receive a night‑movement briefing covering route, terrain obstacles, and speed limits (30 km/h on roads, 20 km/h off‑road)
Ground guides assigned to high‑risk sections and to each convoy split point
NVG and vehicle lighting checks performed during the pre‑movement PCC
Maintain a minimum 100 m spacing between vehicles in limited visibility
-Conduct a short night‑navigation rehearsal on 29 MAY 25; -Use AT‑AK maps and route books to confirm waypoints
Serial OIC, VC lead/trail, Ground Guides, Convoy Commander

subtasks.hazard: Missing or incomplete TRM paperwork leading to compliance violations

values: Dispatch books, DA Form 5987, NATO orders, and HAZDEC forms must be placed in each vehicle prior to 1000 LT check‑in
A pre‑check roster verifies each driver has a completed Route Book, PIR/CCIR guidance, and hard‑copy map
The Marshalling Checklist includes a “Paperwork Complete” column signed by the vehicle crew and the HHT NCOIC
-Run a checklist walk‑through at 1000 LT; -Cross‑reference with the master Marshalling List
Vehicle Crews, Serial OIC, HHT NCOIC

subtasks.hazard: Failure to meet required driver licensing or HAZMAT certification

values: Verify each driver holds a valid USAREUR‑AF, Military, and/or ADR license before the 1015‑1130 window
Check HAZMAT certifications for any vehicle carrying hazardous material and tag accordingly
Drivers without the proper license are reassigned to non‑maneuver roles for the event
-Maintain a licensing matrix on the Marshalling Checklist; -Spot‑check IDs during the CO inspection
Vehicle Crew Leaders, HHT Safety NCO, CO/1SG

subtasks.hazard: Fire or explosion from faulty vehicle fire extinguishers or missing safety equipment

values: Each vehicle must have a serviceable fire extinguisher (check pressure gauge)
First‑aid kits, warning triangles, and convoys placards inspected during the 1130‑1230 vehicle inspection
A dedicated fire‑watch team positioned at the marshaling yard during loading and night movement
-Extinguisher pressure check; -Visual inspection of first‑aid kits; -Assign fire‑watch NCOs
Vehicle Crews, HHT Safety NCO, Fire‑Watch Team

subtasks.hazard: Communication failure between Serial OIC, VC, and higher‑headquarter during night movement

values: All VC AT‑AK devices, WICKR, and Signal Group chat handles verified and tested during the 1015 prep period
Establish a PACE plan: Primary – TSM; Alternate – FM; Contingency – Cell phone
Periodic radio check‑ins (every 30 min) logged by the Convoy Commander
-Conduct a radio/AT‑AK functional test; -Document handles on the Marshalling Checklist
Serial OIC, VC Lead, Convoy Commander, Signal NCO

subtasks.hazard: Accident reporting paperwork not completed or lost during the event

values: Attach a copy of SF‑91 and DD‑Form 518 to each vehicle’s dispatch book
Designate a vehicle (e.g., the lead vehicle) as the “Accident Documentation Point” to collect any reports
Post‑event debrief includes a review of all accident forms for completeness
-Pre‑populate forms before the event; -Collect completed forms at the end of the marshalling
Vehicle Crews, HHT NCOIC, CO/1SG

subtasks.hazard: Environmental hazards (e.g., wet terrain, low visibility) affecting vehicle handling at night

values: Obtain a weather forecast for 30 MAY 25 and brief crews on expected conditions
If precipitation is forecast, increase spacing to 150 m and reduce speed limits by 10 km/h
Assign additional ground guides for mud or icy sections identified on the route map
-Weather briefing at 1000 LT; -Update the convoy SOP on the spot as needed
S2 Weather Cell, Convoy Commander, Ground Guides

overall_supervision_plan: The OIC, RSO, and HHT NCOIC will conduct a pre‑event safety brief covering vehicle inspection, load securement, night navigation, and communication procedures. All control measures are verified through a written Marshalling Checklist, PCC/PCI checks, and a convoy‑level rehearsal. After the event, a debrief will confirm that all documentation is complete and that any deficiencies are corrected before future TRM missions, reducing overall residual risk to low.
mission_task_and_description: Hammer Troop vehicle marshalling preparation on 30 MAY 25 to certify crews for future night TRM operations.
